ğŸ“– API Documentationïƒ

moxel packageïƒ

MOXÎµÎ» is a Python package for parallel calculation of energy voxels, with emphasis on reticular chemistry.

Note

Currently, interactions are modelled with the Lennard-Jones potential.

Submodulesïƒ

moxel.utils moduleïƒ

class moxel.utils.Grid(grid_size=25, cutoff=10, epsilon=50, sigma=2.5)ïƒ

Bases: object

A 3D energy grid over a crystal structure.

Parameters:

  • grid_size (int, default=25) â€“ Number of grid points along each dimension.

  • cutoff (float, default=10) â€“ Cutoff radius for the Lennard-Jones potential.

  • epsilon (float, default=50) â€“ Epsilon value (Îµ/K) of the probe atom.

  • sigma (float, default=2.5) â€“ Sigma value (Ïƒ/â„«) of the probe atom.

structureïƒ

Available only after Grid.load_structure() has been called.

Type:

pymatgen.core.structure.Structure

Available only after Grid.load_structure() has been called.

Type:

Available only after Grid.calculate() has been called.

voxelsïƒ

Available only after Grid.calculate() has been called.

Type:

calculate(cubic_box=False, length=30, potential='lj')ïƒ

Iterate over the grid and return voxels.

For computational efficiency and to assure (approximately) the same spatial resolution, the grid is overlayed over a supercell scaled according to MIC, see mic_scale_factors().

If lattice angles are significantly different than 90Â°, to avoid distortions set cubic_box to True. In this case, the grid is overlayed over a cubic box of size length centered at the origin but periodicity is no longer guaranteed.

Parameters:

  • potential (str, default='lj') â€“ The potential used to calculate voxels. Currently, only the Lennard-Jones potential is supported.

  • cubic_box (bool, default=False) â€“ If True, the simulation box is cubic.

  • length (float, default=30) â€“ The size of the cubic box in Ã…. Takes effect only if cubic_box=True.

Returns:

voxels â€“ The energy voxels as \(e^{-\beta \mathcal{V}}\), to ensure numerical stability.

Return type:

array of shape (grid_size, grid_size, grid_size)

Notes

For structures that can not be processsed, their voxels are filled with zeros.

lj_potential(coords)ïƒ

Calculate Lennard-Jones potential at cartesian or fractional coordinates.

Parameters:

coordinates (array_like of shape (3,)) â€“ If cubic_box=True cartesian. Else, fractional.

Returns:

energy â€“ Energy as \(e^{-\beta \mathcal{V}}\), to ensure numerical stability.

Return type:

float

moxel.utils.batch_clean_and_merge(batch_dirnames, out_name=None)ïƒ

Clean a single batch, or first clean and then merge multiple batches. All batches must have the form:

batch
â”œâ”€â”€voxels.npy
â””â”€â”€names.json

Cleaning is required since the voxels for some structures might be zero, see Grid.calculate().

If len(batch_dirnames) == 1 the cleaned voxels for are stored under batch_dirnames[0]/clean_voxels.npy and the names of their corresponding structures under batch_dirnames[0]/clean_names.json.

If len(batch_dirnames) > 1 the voxels (cleaned and merged) are stored under out_name/clean_voxels.npy and the names of their corresponding structures under out_name/clean_names.json. That is:

out_name
â”œâ”€â”€clean_voxels.npy
â””â”€â”€clean_names.json
Parameters:

  • batch_dirnames (list) â€“ List of paths to the directories of the batches.

  • out_name (str, optional) â€“ Pathname to the directory holding the clean voxels and names. The directory is created if it doesnâ€™t exist. Takes effect only if len(batch_dirnames) > 1. If None voxels and names are stored under ./clean_voxels.npy and ./clean_names.json.

Returns:

exit_status â€“ If no voxels are missing 0 else 1.

Return type:

int

moxel.utils.mic_scale_factors(r, lattice_vectors)ïƒ

Return scale factors to satisfy minimum image convention (MIC) [1] .

Parameters:

  • r (float) â€“ The cutoff radius used in MIC convetion.

  • lattice_vectors (array of shape (3, 3)) â€“ The lattice vectors of the unit cell. Each row corresponds to a lattice vector.

Returns:

scale_factors â€“ scale_factors[i] scales lattice_vectors[i].

Return type:

array of shape (3,)

References

[1]

  1. Smith, â€œThe Minimum Image Convention in Non-Cubic MD Cellsâ€, 1989.

moxel.utils.plot_voxels(voxels, *, fill_pattern=None, colorbar=True, cmap='viridis', **kwargs)ïƒ

Visualizing voxels with Axes3d.voxels.

Parameters:

  • voxels (3D array) â€“

  • fill_pattern (3D array of bool, optional) â€“ A 3D array of truthy values, indicating which voxels to fill. If not specified, all voxels are filled.

  • colorbar (bool, default=True) â€“ Whether to include a colorbar.

  • cmap (str, default='viridis') â€“ Colormap that colorizes the voxels based on their value.

  • **kwargs â€“

    Valid keyword arguments for Axes3d.voxels.

    Warning

    Do not pass the argument facecolors of Axes3d.voxels. This argument is used under the hood by plot_voxels_mpl() to generate the colors of the voxels based on the specified cmap.

Returns:

fig

Return type:

Figure

moxel.utils.voxels_from_dir(cif_dirname, grid_size=25, cutoff=10, epsilon=50, sigma=2.5, cubic_box=False, length=30, out_name=None)ïƒ

Calculate voxels from .cif files in cif_dirname and save them in out_name as array of shape (n_samples, grid_size, grid_size, grid_size), where n_samples is the number of .cif files in cif_dirname.

Parameters:

  • cif_dirname (str) â€“ Pathname to the directory containing the .cif files.

  • grid_size (int, default=25) â€“ Number of grid points along each dimension.

  • cutoff (float, default=10) â€“ Cutoff radius for the Lennard-Jones potential.

  • epsilon (float, default=50) â€“ Epsilon value (Îµ/K) of the probe atom.

  • cubic_box (bool, default=False) â€“ If True, the simulation box is cubic.

  • length (float, default=30) â€“ The size of the cubic box in Ã…. Takes effect only if cubic_box=True.

  • sigma (float, default=25) â€“ Sigma value (Ïƒ/â„«) of the probe atom.

  • out_name (str, optional) â€“ Pathname to the file holding the voxels. If not specified, voxels are stored in ./voxels.npy.

Notes

  • Samples in output array follow the order in sorted(os.listdir(cif_dirname)).

  • For structures that can not be processsed, their voxels are filled with zeros.

moxel.utils.voxels_from_file(cif_pathname, grid_size=25, cutoff=10, epsilon=50, sigma=2.5, cubic_box=False, length=30, only_voxels=True)ïƒ

Return voxels from .cif file.

Parameters:

  • cif_pathname (str) â€“ Pathname to the .cif file.

  • grid_size (int, default=25) â€“ Number of grid points along each dimension.

  • cutoff (float, default=10) â€“ Cutoff radius for the Lennard-Jones potential.

  • epsilon (float, default=50) â€“ Epsilon value (Îµ/K) of the probe atom.

  • sigma (float, default=25) â€“ Sigma value (Ïƒ/â„«) of the probe atom.

  • cubic_box (bool, default=False) â€“ If True, the simulation box is cubic.

  • length (float, default=30) â€“ The size of the cubic box in Ã…. Takes effect only if cubic_box=True.

  • only_voxels (bool, default=True) â€“ Determines out type.

Returns:

out â€“ If only_voxels=True, array of shape (grid_size, grid_size, grid_size). Otherwise, Grid.

Return type:

array or Grid

Notes

  • For structures that can not be processsed, their voxels are filled with zeros.

moxel.utils.voxels_from_files(cif_pathnames, grid_size=25, cutoff=10, epsilon=50, sigma=2.5, cubic_box=False, length=30, out_name=None)ïƒ

Calculate voxels from a list of .cif files and save them in out_name as array of shape (n_samples, grid_size, grid_size, grid_size), where n_samples is the number of is the number of .cif files in cif_pathnames.

Parameters:

  • cif_pathanmes (list) â€“ List of pathnames to the .cif files.

  • grid_size (int, default=25) â€“ Number of grid points along each dimension.

  • cutoff (float, default=10) â€“ Cutoff radius for the Lennard-Jones potential.

  • epsilon (float, default=50) â€“ Epsilon value (Îµ/K) of the probe atom.

  • sigma (float, default=25) â€“ Sigma value (Ïƒ/â„«) of the probe atom.

  • cubic_box (bool, default=False) â€“ If True, the simulation box is cubic.

  • length (float, default=30) â€“ The size of the cubic box in Ã…. Takes effect only if cubic_box=True.

  • out_name (str, optional) â€“ Pathname to the file holding the voxels. If not specified, voxels are stored in ./voxels.npy.

Notes

  • Samples in output array follow the order in cif_pathnames.

  • For structures that can not be processsed, their voxels are filled with zeros.
